text: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Dear Harry, Congratulations for your promotion as a Manager. One of the most important aspect of being a successful Manager is to have a high performance team. In this sense, it is important to have the team motivated. A motivated team is a group that normally produces much more than a demotivated team. Also when you motivate a team it is willing to reach higher standards of quality. Consequently, the company benefits from motivated teams. Additionally, there are also clear benefits for each team member because when an individual has a good performance and a high level of excellence in the services or products where he is involved of his professional career will be enhanced by these skills giving him more opportunities to move forward for reaching a promotion. But how can you have a team motivated? There are some key aspects to have into account: - Listen every team member of your team carefully. If each one realize that you are listening honestly and sympathetically to them then you will build trust on your team. - Work with your team on a collaborative way. It is not a micromanagement format it is all about how to help them to reach higher goals with your support. - Recognise their goals in public and reward them. It is not needed to give them more money, sometimes it would be enough with some extra days off, other times a costly and customized training would be more valuable from their perspective to feel rewarded. - Avoid things like: be angry, don’t praise people when they deserve. If you do these things make sure that you will have a demotivated team. Good luck with the challenge of having a motivated team. Correction: Dear Harry, Congratulations for your promotion as a Manager. One of the most important aspect of being a successful Manager is to have a highperformance team. In this sense, it is important to have the team motivated. A motivated team is a group that normally produces much more than a demotivated team. Alsowhen you motivate a teamit is willing to reach higher standards of quality. Consequently, the company benefits from motivated teams. Additionally, there are also clear benefits for each team member because when an individual has a good performance and a high level of excellence in the services or products where he is involved of his professional career will be enhanced by these skills giving him more opportunities to move forward for reaching a promotion. But how can you have a team motivated? There are some key aspects to have into account: - Listen every team member of your team carefully. If each one realize that you are listening honestly and sympathetically to them then you will build trust on your team. - Work with your team on a collaborative way. It is not a micromanagement formatit is all about how to help them to reach higher goals with your support. - Recognise their goals in public and reward them. It is not needed to give them more mone, sometimes it would be enough with some extra days off, other timesa costly and customized training would be more valuable from their perspective to feel rewarded. - Avoid things like: be angry, don’t praise people when they deserve. If you do these things make sure that you will have a demotivated team. Good luck with the challenge of having a motivated team.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. Response: On 09-04, Cessna 123 experienced minor difficulties during landing at [insert airport]. The approach was initially stable; however, during final descent, moderate crosswinds caused slight deviation from the centerline. The pilot corrected with appropriate rudder input, but the aircraft touched down slightly off-center and bounced once before stabilizing. No injuries occurred, and the aircraft taxied to the apron without further incident. A post-flight inspection revealed no damage to the aircraft. Preliminary assessment suggests wind conditions and runway surface contributed to the event. The pilot followed correct procedures and maintained control throughout. Further review of weather data and runway conditions is underway. Correction: On 09-04, Cessna 123 experienced minor difficulties during landing at [insert airport]. The approach was initially stable; however, during final descent, moderate crosswinds caused slight deviation from the centerline. The pilot corrected with appropriate rudder input, but the aircraft touched down slightly off-center and bounced once before stabilizing. No injuries occurred, and the aircraft taxied to the apron without further incident. A post-flight inspection revealed no damage to the aircraft. Preliminary assessment suggests wind conditions and runway surface contributed to the event. The pilot followed correct procedures and maintained control throughout. Further review of weather data and runway conditions is underway.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: A consultant has emailed you a list of issues, which the code of conduct could address. Write a reminder to the employees of the code of conduct rules to address these issues. Type in the input box. Write 65-100 words. Response: Subject: Friendly Reminder: Code of Conduct

Dear Team,

This is a friendly reminder regarding our Code of Conduct. Recent observations highlight a need for renewed attention to certain areas. Please remember that smoking is prohibited in the toilets, and we ask all employees to adhere to the dress code. Punctuality is essential, and maintaining clean, organized workspaces benefits everyone. Finally, confidential documents must remain secure and within the office premises. Let's all work together to uphold these standards.

Thank you for your cooperation in advance.

Regards,
Jonathon Dimbleby Correction: <input>Subject: Friendly Reminder: Code of Conduct

Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Read the blog post. Then write about a city you visited. Type in the input box. Write 90-110 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: I visited San Francisco last year. It was a wonderful American West Coast landscape that far exceeded my imagination. The view of the Pacific Ocean and the cityscape from the Golden Gate Bridge was one of the most exciting things I have ever seen. The self-driving taxis running through the city lined with historical buildings were very unique and interesting. The clam chowder, Dungeness crab and other seafood were the best. It is true that prices are high, but I can say with confidence that Napa wine is excellent value for money. There may be negative aspects such as homelessness like in other cities, but Shohei's home run at Oracle Park made all my memory the positive. Correction: I visited San Francisco last year. It was a wonderful American West Coast landscape that far exceeded my imagination. The view of the Pacific Ocean and the cityscape from the Golden Gate Bridge was one of the most exciting things I have ever seen. The self-driving taxis running through the city lined with historical buildings were very unique and interesting. The clam chowder, Dungeness craband other seafood were the best. It is true that prices are high, but I can say with confidence that Napa wine is excellent value for money. There may be negative aspects such as homelessnesslike in other cities, but Shohei's home run at Oracle Park made all my memory the positive.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor, symbolism, and questioning stand out as the most useful to me. Metaphor allows for vivid comparisons that breathe life into writing, helping readers connect abstract ideas to tangible imagery. Symbolism, on the other hand, enriches writing by layering deeper meanings beneath the surface, making narratives more engaging and thought-provoking. These techniques are particularly valuable in creative writing, where emotional depth and layered interpretations enhance storytelling. Additionally, questioning serves as a powerful tool to develop ideas and encourage critical thinking. By asking "what if" or "why," writers can push their thoughts further, uncovering fresh perspectives and unexpected angles. This technique is incredibly effective when brainstorming or refining arguments in analytical writing. While free writing and loop writing help generate ideas freely, structured techniques like listing and cubing provide organization, making them useful for planning essays or breaking down complex topics. Each technique has its own strengths, but the most effective ones depend on the writing purpose and style. Correction: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor, symbolism, and questioning stand out as the most useful to me. Metaphor allows for vivid comparisons that breathe life into writing, helping readers connect abstract ideas to tangible imagery. Symbolism, on the other hand, enriches writing by layering deeper meanings beneath the surface, making narratives more engaging and thought-provoking. These techniques are particularly valuable in creative writing, where emotional depth and layered interpretations enhance storytelling. Additionally, questioning serves as a powerful tool to develop ideas and encourage critical thinking. By asking "what if" or "why," writers can push their thoughts further, uncovering fresh perspectives and unexpected angles. This technique is incredibly effective when brainstorming or refining arguments in analytical writing. While free writing and loop writing help generate ideas freely, structured techniques like listing and cubing provide organization, making them useful for planning essays or breaking down complex topics. Each technique has its own strengths, but the most effective ones depend on the writing purpose and style.

Prompt Level: 8.0 Prompt: Write a personal statement for a careers website. Give your job title and describe your long- and short-term career goals. State your time frame for your career goals and development plans. Write 80-100 words. Type in the input box. Use your own words where possible. Response: As a lawyer, I am passionate about defend the law and dedicated to continuous growth. My short-term goal is to enhance my expertise in the court within the next year, while contributing effectively to making the law fair. Long term, I aim to take on leadership opportunities and drive innovation in my office within five years. I am committed to ongoing professional development through certifications, mentorship, and hands-on experience to achieve these aspirations. I love my job, it's amazing! Correction: As a lawyer, I am passionate about defend the law and dedicated to continuous growth. My short-term goal is to enhance my expertise in the court within the next year, while contributing effectively to making the law fair. Long term, I aim to take on leadership opportunities and drive innovation in my office within five years. I am committed to ongoing professional development through certifications, mentorship, and hands-on experience to achieve these aspirations. I love my job, it's amazing!

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: My hometown is Veracruz, a port city on the Gulf of Mexico, in contrast to Mexico City, the capital of the country. While both cities are part of Mexico, they offer very different experiences. Veracruz is known for its coastal beauty, warm climate, and vibrant cultural atmosphere, with a rich history. It’s also famous for its music, especially the lively rhythms of "jarochos", and the delicious seafood. Mexico City, on the other hand, is a bustling metropolis with a high-energy vibe. The city has numerous museums, trendy restaurant and numerous events, where every stret holds something new to explore. Nevertheless, unlike the calm of Veracruz, Mexico City thrives with constant activity and traffic. The overcowding of people and pollutionare constant issues that affect the quality of life. Moreover, the cost of living in the capital is significantly higher, making it less affordable for many people. Finally, each place has its charm, depending on whether your preferences for tranquility or excitement. Correction: My hometown is Veracruz, a port city on the Gulf of Mexico, in contrast to Mexico City, the capital of the country. While both cities are part of Mexico, they offer very different experiences. Veracruz is known for its coastal beauty, warm climate, and vibrant cultural atmosphere, with a rich history. It’s also famous for its music, especially the lively rhythms of "jarochos", and the delicious seafood. Mexico City, on the other hand, is a bustling metropolis with a high-energy vibe. The city has numerous museums, trendy restaurant and numerous events, where every stret holds something new to explore. Nevertheless, unlike the calm of Veracruz, Mexico City thrives with constant activity and traffic. The overcowding of people and pollutionare constant issues that affect the quality of life. Moreover, the cost of living in the capital is significantly higher, making it less affordable for many people. Finally, each place has its charm, depending on whether your preferences for tranquility or excitement.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Three months ago, our collaboration with Crum encountered a few hurdles due to unresolved product defects and additional technical challenges. These issues threatened the integrity of our service and strained client trust. Acknowledging the severity of the situation, we took swift action to refine our processes and restore confidence. Our first step was to overhaul the way we delivered updates, ensuring they were more stable and better timed to customer needs. Additionally, we enhanced our Quality Assurance protocols, tightening controls and implementing more rigorous testing to catch defects earlier in the development cycle. These improvements have already had a positive impact on the performance and reliability of our offerings. Thanks to these efforts, we are proud to share that our partnership with Crum has been renewed. Even more gratifying, Crum commended us for our unwavering dedication to quality—a testament to the progress we've made. Looking ahead, we are committed to providing ongoing support to Crum, working closely to preempt issues and elevate the customer experience. This renewed chapter sets the stage for stronger collaboration and sustained growth. Correction: Three months ago, our collaboration with Crum encountered a few hurdles due to unresolved product defects and additional technical challenges. These issues threatened the integrity of our service and strained client trust. Acknowledging the severity of the situation, we took swift action to refine our processes and restore confidence. Our first step was to overhaul the way we delivered updates, ensuring they were more stable and better timed to customer needs. Additionally, we enhanced our Quality Assurance protocols, tightening controls and implementing more rigorous testing to catch defects earlier in the development cycle. These improvements have already had a positive impact on the performance and reliability of our offerings. Thanks to these efforts, we are proud to share that our partnership with Crum has been renewed. Even more gratifying, Crum commended us for our unwavering dedication to quality—a testament to the progress we've made. Looking ahead, we are committed to providing ongoing support to Crum, working closely to preempt issues and elevate the customer experience. This renewed chapter sets the stage for stronger collaboration and sustained growth.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. He had an exceptionally strong start, demonstrating remarkable cleverness and a strong work ethic. His innovative ideas and dedication have been invaluable, culminating in him finding and fixing a critical product error that saved the company a substantial amount of money. His achievements, including a promotion after just six months and being named Employee of the Month twice, are well-deserved. To continue his professional growth, we need to address the recent instances of missed deadlines. Improving communication with the team about potential delays is a key area for development. By focusing on improving his time management and becoming more of a team player, we are confident that Oliver will continue to be an invaluable asset to our success. Correction: Performance Review: Oliver Murray Oliver has made a significant impact in his first year with the company. He had an exceptionally strong start, demonstrating remarkable cleverness and a strong work ethic. Prompt Level: 6.0 Prompt: Write about a company problem you are familiar with. Describe the problem. What possible solutions were there? Was a solution found? For reasons of confidentiality, do not mention a real company name, real people's names or real product names. Use general terms and descriptions instead. Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: A manufacturing company in the US faced low employee morale and high production costs, making it hard to compete. The company's outdated technology and lack of employee engagement were major contributors. To address this, they invested in modern technology to streamline processes and reduce costs. They also implemented employee recognition programs to boost morale. Additionally, they explored outsourcing options to optimize production. These changes improved efficiency, reduced costs, and enhanced employee satisfaction, helping the company stay competitive. By adapting to the changing market, they were able to regain their footing and achieve long-term success. Correction: A manufacturing company in the US faced low employee morale and high production costs, making it hard to compete. The company's outdated technology and lack of employee engagement were major contributors. To address this, they invested in modern technology to streamline processes and reduce costs. They also implemented employee recognition programs to boost morale. Additionally, they explored outsourcing options to optimize production. These changes improved efficiency, reduced costs, and enhanced employee satisfaction, helping the company stay competitive. By adapting to the changing market, they were able to regain their footing and achieve long-term success.

We do have some "commons" like an Indian that protects the forest, the werewolf who is half man and half wolf, the mule without a head, but there are some really interesting creatures, such as the Boto. The Boto is like a dolphin, but its color is pink, and according to the legend, the Boto comes to the land every night, becomes human, seduces the women to have a baby with him, and then it disappears. Another one very loved by children is Saci-Pererê, its origin is based on Indian and African historians, this little guy has just one leg, wears a red cap, and smokes a cigar. Saci is well known for your mischievous and playful behavior, who performs mischief at night. We have other creatures, but in my humble opinion, these are one of the most interesting. People with little knowledge of the world have built their fame on playing games, testing things, or reviewing food. They often express their opinions on political or worldview issues, thus shaping young people's perceptions of the world. Unfortunately, nowadays, all you need is a phone with a camera and an idea of “gaining a reach” to become a “modern-day celebrity.” The pursuit of content reach and monetization has also led to the trivialization of some behaviors that were once considered obscene or inappropriate just a few years ago. What might have been disapproval or embarrassing in the past is now often normalized by online idols. Rather than educating or inspiring young audiences, many influencers focus on gaining popularity and maximizing reach, often at the expense of ethics and social responsibility. These media-savvy individuals exploit their platforms for publicity, creating crass publicity stunts that keep them in the spotlight they desperately crave. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane is made up of several key parts, each serving a specific function to enable flight. The **fuselage** is the main body of the aircraft, housing the cockpit, passengers, and cargo. It provides structural support and connects all other components.

The **wings** are essential for generating lift. As air flows over and under the wings, their shape creates an upward force that allows the plane to rise and stay aloft. Wings may also contain fuel tanks and support devices like flaps and ailerons, which help control the aircraft's direction and stability.

The **tail**, or empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and vertical fin. These structures help maintain balance and control. The horizontal stabilizer ensures pitch stability (up and down movement), while the vertical fin helps the plane maintain a straight course by stabilizing yaw (side-to-side movement).

Lastly, the **engines** provide the thrust needed for the airplane to move forward. Modern airplanes typically use jet engines or turboprops, which propel the aircraft and enable the wings to generate lift.

Together, these parts work in harmony to make flight possible. Correction: <input>An airplane is made up of several key parts, each serving a specific function to enable flight. The **fuselage** is the main body of the aircraft, housing the cockpit, passengers, and cargo. It provides structural support and connects all other components.

The **wings** are essential for generating lift. As air flows over and under the wings, their shape creates an upward force that allows the plane to rise and stay aloft. Wings may also contain fuel tanks and support devices like flaps and ailerons, which help control the aircraft's direction and stability.

The **tail**, or empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and vertical fin. These structures help maintain balance and control. The horizontal stabilizer ensures pitch stability (up and down movement), while the vertical fin helps the plane maintain a straight course by stabilizing yaw (side-to-side movement).

Lastly, the **engines** provide the thrust needed for the airplane to move forward. Modern airplanes typically use jet engines or turboprops, which propel the aircraft and enable the wings to generate lift.

Together, these parts work in harmony to make flight possible.</input>

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Learning a new language is an exciting yet often difficult journey. Many students face challenges that can slow their progress or make them feel discouraged. One common issue is the fear of making mistakes, which can prevent learners from speaking or participating actively in class. This fear is often rooted in a desire to be perfect rather than focusing on communication.

Another major challenge is maintaining motivation. At first, learning a new language can feel fresh and rewarding. However, over time, students may feel stuck or frustrated when progress becomes less noticeable. To stay motivated, it helps to set small, realistic goals and celebrate each achievement.

Time management is also a critical challenge. Language learning requires consistent practice, but many students struggle to balance it with other responsibilities. Creating a study routine and integrating language into daily life—such as watching foreign-language shows or journaling—can help.

Lastly, exposure to real-life language use is limited in classroom settings. Without regular opportunities to practice with native speakers, students may struggle with listening and speaking skills. Seeking language exchange partners or online communities can make a significant difference.

In conclusion, while language learning is challenging, identifying these obstacles and addressing them with practical strategies can lead to steady progress and greater confidence. Correction: <input>Learning a new language is an exciting yet often difficult journey. Many students face challenges that can slow their progress or make them feel discouraged. One common issue is the fear of making mistakes, which can prevent learners from speaking or participating actively in class. This fear is often rooted in a desire to be perfect rather than focusing on communication.

Another major challenge is maintaining motivation. At first, learning a new language can feel fresh and rewarding. However, over time, students may feel stuck or frustrated when progress becomes less noticeable. To stay motivated, it helps to set small, realistic goals and celebrate each achievement.

Time management is also a critical challenge. Language learning requires consistent practice, but many students struggle to balance it with other responsibilities. Creating a study routine and integrating language into daily life—such as watching foreign-language shows or journaling—can help.

Lastly, exposure to real-life language use is limited in classroom settings. Without regular opportunities to practice with native speakers, students may struggle with listening and speaking skills. Seeking language exchange partners or online communities can make a significant difference.

In conclusion, while language learning is challenging, identifying these obstacles and addressing them with practical strategies can lead to steady progress and greater confidence.</input>

Hi Murillo,

I hope you’re doing well! I took a close look at your shop premises and the insurance quotes you’ve received. Given that the building is quite old, it’s understandable why the premiums are high. However, there are some changes you can make to reduce risks and possibly lower your insurance costs.

First, the blocked drainpipes and leaky roof on the exterior should be fixed as soon as possible to prevent water damage and structural problems. Also, the untidy yard and cluttered sidewalk can pose safety hazards, so clearing these areas is important.

Inside the shop, poor lighting and stacked boxes increase the risk of accidents. Improving lighting and organizing storage will help. The old fire extinguishers need to be replaced or serviced to meet safety standards. Lastly, loose chemicals should be securely stored to avoid any dangerous spills.

Making these improvements will not only protect your business and customers but may also convince insurers to offer you better rates. Let me know if you want help planning the repairs!

Best,

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesn’t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. He has got a few quotes for property and liability insurance, but they have been very high. He asks you to do a risk assessment of the premises. Have a look at your checklist, then write him an email advising him of the changes he has to make. Write 150-200 words. Response: Subject: Risk Assessment and Recommendations for Your New Shop

Hi [Friend's Name],

I’ve looked over the risk assessment checklist for your shop, and I think there are a few key areas we can address to reduce your insurance premiums and make the premises safer overall.

1. **Building Condition**: Since the building is old, it’s important to ensure that the roof, windows, and structural integrity are sound. If there are any leaks, cracks, or weaknesses, these should be repaired to prevent further damage and potential liability claims.

2. **Fire Safety**: Make sure there are working smoke detectors, fire extinguishers, and clear exit routes. You should also check if the building has an up-to-date fire alarm system.

3. **Electrical Safety**: Have a licensed electrician inspect the wiring and ensure that everything meets current safety standards. Faulty wiring is a common cause of fires.

4. **Security**: Install adequate lighting outside and consider an alarm system or CCTV to prevent theft or vandalism, which can impact your insurance.

5. **Health and Safety**: Keep walkways clear of obstructions and ensure your store is compliant with any local health and safety regulations.

Addressing these issues will not only make your shop safer but might also lower your insurance costs. Let me know if you need help with anything else!

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Exploring the Charm of Kyoto, Then the Energy of New York City

Kyoto, Japan, is my favorite city because of its serene beauty and deep cultural roots. Walking through Kyoto feels like stepping into a living museum. Ancient temples, peaceful gardens, and traditional tea houses create a calm, reflective atmosphere. The pace of life is slower, encouraging mindfulness and appreciation of small details—like the sound of bamboo rustling or the sight of cherry blossoms falling.

Then there’s New York City, a place that pulses with energy and ambition. Skyscrapers tower over bustling streets, and every corner offers something new—street performers, food trucks, or spontaneous conversations. Unlike Kyoto’s quiet charm, New York thrives on movement and diversity. It’s a city where people chase dreams and where cultures collide in vibrant harmony.

While Kyoto offers peace and tradition, New York offers excitement and innovation. Both cities are unforgettable, but in very different ways. One soothes the soul; the other sparks the imagination. Correction: <input>Exploring the Charm of Kyoto, Then the Energy of New York City

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane consists of several key parts that work together to ensure it can fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, providing space for passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots control the aircraft. It also serves as a structural frame that holds the other parts in place.

The wings are crucial for flight. They generate lift by moving air faster over the top surface than the bottom, creating an upward force that allows the plane to stay in the air. The shape and angle of the wings are carefully designed to provide the most efficient lift.

The tail of the airplane, also known as the empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and the vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps to keep the plane level and prevent pitching, while the vertical stabilizer controls the plane’s yaw, or side-to-side movement.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust needed for the airplane to move forward. Most commercial airplanes use jet engines that take in air, compress it, mix it with fuel, and then expel it at high speed to propel the aircraft forward.

Each of these parts works together to ensure the airplane can fly smoothly and safely. Correction: <input>An airplane consists of several key parts that work together to ensure it can fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, providing space for passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots control the aircraft. It also serves as a structural frame that holds the other parts in place.

The wings are crucial for flight. They generate lift by moving air faster over the top surface than the bottom, creating an upward force that allows the plane to stay in the air. The shape and angle of the wings are carefully designed to provide the most efficient lift.

The tail of the airplane, also known as the empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and the vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps to keep the plane level and prevent pitching, while the vertical stabilizer controls the plane’s yaw, or side-to-side movement.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust needed for the airplane to move forward. Most commercial airplanes use jet engines that take in air, compress it, mix it with fuel, and then expel it at high speed to propel the aircraft forward.

Each of these parts works together to ensure the airplane can fly smoothly and safely.</input>

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Response: The landing gear should be retracted after liftoff when the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure. Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in the GEAR DOWN position. The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase. During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel. The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operation as well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit. In most airplanes, the gear switch is shaped like a wheel in order to facilitate positive identification and to differentiate it from other cockpit controls. A landing gear safety switch, sometimes referred to as asquat switch, is usually mounted in a bracket on one of the main gear shock struts. The pilot should then turn on thebattery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked. Response: Applying for a mortgage in Argentina is nearly impossible. Due to the instability of our currency, banks do not offer mortgages. Moreover, people do not want to compromise their savings for twenty-five years as it is difficult to plan that far ahead. The history of our country has made us precautious: we save all our money in a foreign currency, do not keep it in the banks, and high inflation encourages us to spend instead of saving due to how quickly prices increase. Additionally, governments do not keep steady policies. Let’s imagine that mortgages did exist here, and were accesible, there would still be uncertainty. Let’s say that you manage to obtain an interview with the bank to apply. The banker reviews your bank statements, credit rating, and employment history concluding that you might qualify for a loan. However, they tell you that property values are in US dollars and that the loan is in Argentinian pesos. Therefore, if it happens that in between the time the loan was processed and you actually purchase the house, the foreign currency rate between ARS and USD dramatically increase, it might happen that the loan will not be enough to pay the property and the bank will not take any responsibility for that. Due to these facts and the government not promoting such loans, many people resign to rent an apartment permanently. In the best scenario, you can save enough money in USD over the years to purchase a property without a mortgage. Correction: Applying for a mortgage in Argentina is nearly impossible. The most popular stock index for tracking the performance of the world market is The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong. The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong is the oldest and the best-known index. Properties and Utilities Sub-indices have risen dramatically, due to growth from China. So learning how assets are correlated can give you great insight into what to expect for other products you might be interested in trading in world. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Criticism towards a celebrity often focuses on their personal behavior, public statements, artistic choices, or perceived lack of authenticity, with common criticisms including: unprofessional conduct, hypocrisy, offensive remarks, poor decision-making, excessive self-promotion, unrealistic portrayals, and a disconnect from real-life issues; however, the nature of criticism can vary depending on the celebrity and the context of the situation. Key aspects of celebrity criticism: Personal life: Critics may scrutinize a celebrity's relationships, substance abuse issues, legal troubles, or family dynamics, sometimes considering their private life as a reflection of their character. Public image: A celebrity's persona, particularly if perceived as carefully curated or inauthentic, can be a target for criticism, with accusations of being "too perfect" or not being true to themselves. Social and political stances: When celebrities express strong opinions on social or political issues, they can face backlash from those who disagree with their views, especially if seen as opportunistic or uninformed. Artistic performance: Actors, musicians, and other performers can be criticized for their acting skills, musical quality, or creative choices, with critiques focusing on technical aspects or the overall artistic direction. Impact on society: Some criticism focuses on the potential negative influence a celebrity might have on their fans, particularly regarding body image, consumerism, or unhealthy behaviors. Examples of celebrity criticism: "Cancel culture": A recent trend where celebrities face intense public backlash and potential career consequences for past actions or statements considered offensive or harmful. "Unrealistic portrayals": Actors might be criticized for perpetuating unrealistic beauty standards or lifestyle expectations through their roles. "Hypocrisy": When a celebrity promotes a certain lifestyle or ethical values while engaging in behavior that contradicts those values. Important considerations: Privacy concerns: While celebrities often put themselves in the public eye, there are limits to what aspects of their personal life should be subject to criticism. Constructive criticism: Criticism can be valuable when it focuses on specific areas of improvement or raises important issues, rather than simply being personal attacks. Media bias: The way the media portrays a celebrity can influence public perception and sometimes lead to unfair or exaggerated criticism. Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: Media has changed a lot in my lifetime. When I was younger, printed magazines and television were the most important sources of news and entertainment. People waited for the evening news to find out what was happening in the world. Now, most media is digital: I use my phone, tablet, and computer to read the news, watch videos, and follow social media. This change has made information faster and more accessible; I can check the news at any time of the day. However, it has also changed my reading habits. I used to read long texts and books more often, but now I tend to read shorter texts—like headlines, tweets, and posts. My attention span is shorter. Still, I enjoy the variety and interactivity of digital content: I can comment, share, and connect with others easily. In short, while media has become more convenient and diverse, I try to balance quick updates with thoughtful reading. Correction: Media has changed a lot in my lifetime. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Should e-nav tools replace all traditional equipment on ships? Use your own ideas. Type in the input box. Write 80-100 words. Response: While e-navigation tools offer greater efficiency, accuracy, and real-time data, they should not fully replace traditional equipment on ships. Technology can fail due to power loss, cyberattacks, or system errors. In such cases, traditional tools like paper charts, compasses, and sextants serve as essential backups. Moreover, relying solely on digital systems could reduce critical navigation skills among crew members. A balanced approach, using both modern and traditional tools, ensures safety and resilience in maritime operations under all conditions. Redundancy is key in such a high-risk environment. Correction: <input>While e-navigation tools offer greater efficiency, accuracy, and real-time data, they should not fully replace traditional equipment on ships. Technology can fail due to power loss, cyberattacks, or system errors. In such cases, traditional tools like paper charts, compasses, and sextants serve as essential backups. Moreover, relying solely on digital systems could reduce critical navigation skills among crew members. A balanced approach, using both modern and traditional tools, ensures safety and resilience in maritime operations under all conditions. Redundancy is key in such a high-risk environment.</input>

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Proponents argue that CSR initiatives foster a positive public image, enhance customer loyalty, and attract top talent. Companies like Patagonia and Ben & Jerry's are often cited as exemplars, demonstrating that ethical practices can coexist with profitability. These businesses have successfully integrated environmental stewardship and social equity into their core operations, proving that CSR can be a win-win strategy for both the company and society.

Critics, however, contend that CSR is often a facade, a marketing gimmick designed to distract from less savory business practices. They point to instances where companies engage in "greenwashing," promoting environmentally friendly initiatives while continuing harmful practices behind the scenes. This skepticism underscores the need for transparency and accountability in CSR efforts.

In my view, CSR is not just a moral imperative but a strategic necessity in today's interconnected world. Companies wield significant influence and resources, and with that comes the responsibility to contribute positively to society. Effective CSR requires genuine commitment, clear goals, and measurable outcomes. It should be embedded in the company's culture and operations, rather than being treated as an afterthought or a mere public relations tool.

Ultimately, the true measure of CSR's success lies in its impact. When done right, CSR can drive meaningful change, fostering a more sustainable and equitable world while also benefiting the business itself. Therefore, companies should strive to move beyond superficial gestures and embrace CSR as a core component of their identity and strategy. Correction: <input>Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Proponents argue that CSR initiatives foster a positive public image, enhance customer loyalty, and attract top talent. They point to instances where companies engage in "greenwashing," promoting environmentally friendly initiatives while continuing harmful practices behind the scenes. This skepticism underscores the need for transparency and accountability in CSR efforts.

In my view, CSR is not just a moral imperative but a strategic necessity in today's interconnected world. Companies wield significant influence and resources, and with that comes the responsibility to contribute positively to society. Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: To create a motivated, engaged, and productive workforce, it is vital for leaders to take a strategic approach that aligns employees' personal and professional growth with the company's goals. By incentivizing employees and linking their success directly to the company's achievements, managers can create a sense of ownership and motivation, where individuals feel that their contributions directly impact their rewards and overall success. Additionally, taking an active interest in employees' career development and offering mentorship opportunities fosters a deeper connection between the individual and the organization, ensuring they feel supported in their professional journey. Providing opportunities for ongoing training and skill development ensures that employees are equipped with the tools they need to thrive, creating a culture of continuous improvement. It's equally important to promote a healthy work-life balance by recognizing that employees have lives outside of the workplace, and showing empathy toward their personal commitments will build loyalty and well-being. Listening actively to employees, especially when they raise concerns or express dissatisfaction, not only helps to address potential issues early on but also fosters a culture of trust where employees feel heard and valued. Acknowledging their contributions, celebrating their achievements, and giving credit where it's due motivates individuals to perform at their best. On the flip side, behaviors that demotivate employees, such as disrespecting them, taking credit for their work, losing one's temper, unfairly placing blame, or failing to provide recognition for good work, can severely harm morale, leading to disengagement and decreased productivity. It's essential to remember that the actions and attitudes of leadership directly influence the overall atmosphere within a company, and creating a positive, supportive, and respectful environment is the foundation for achieving long-term success. Correction: To create a motivated, engaged, and productive workforce, it is vital for leaders to take a strategic approach that aligns employees' personal and professional growth with the company's goals. By incentivizing employees and linking their success directly to the company's achievements, managers can create a sense of ownership and motivation, where individuals feel that their contributions directly impact their rewards and overall success. Additionally, taking an active interest in employees' career development and offering mentorship opportunities fosters a deeper connection between the individual and the organization, ensuring they feel supported in their professional journey. Providing opportunities for ongoing training and skill development ensures that employees are equipped with the tools they need to thrive, creating a culture of continuous improvement. It's equally important to promote a healthy work-life balance by recognizing that employees have lives outside of the workplace, and showing empathy toward their personal commitments will build loyalty and well-being. Listening actively to employees, especially when they raise concerns or express dissatisfaction, not only helps to address potential issues early on but also fosters a culture of trust where employees feel heard and valued. Acknowledging their contributions, celebrating their achievements, and giving credit where it's due motivates individuals to perform at their best. On the flip side, behaviors that demotivate employees, such as disrespecting them, taking credit for their work, losing one's temper, unfairly placing blame, or failing to provide recognition for good work, can severely harm morale, leading to disengagement and decreased productivity. It's essential to remember that the actions and attitudes of leadership directly influence the overall atmosphere within a company, and creating a positive, supportive, and respectful environment is the foundation for achieving long-term success.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Robots are becoming increasingly common in various industries across my country, revolutionizing the way tasks are performed. In manufacturing, robots assemble products with precision and efficiency, reducing costs and increasing production speed. In healthcare, robotic-assisted surgeries allow for greater accuracy, while robotic exoskeletons help patients regain mobility. Service robots are also used in restaurants, hotels, and even customer service roles. While I find this technological advancement fascinating, I also have mixed feelings about the rapid integration of robots. On the positive side, robots improve productivity, enhance safety by handling dangerous tasks, and provide assistance in areas like elderly care. However, there are concerns about job displacement, as automation may replace human workers in certain industries. Additionally, over-reliance on robots could lead to a loss of critical skills and reduced human interaction. Society must find a balance embracing robotics for their benefits while ensuring that people are not left behind. Education and job retraining programs can help workers adapt to this evolving landscape. Service robots are also used in restaurants, hotels, and even customer service roles. Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, implemented on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate trade barriers and tariffs, fostering a trilateral trade bloc in North America. As one of the largest free trade zones in the world, it sought to increase economic integration and cross-border trade among the member countries. NAFTA significantly impacted the economies of the three nations. It facilitated the flow of goods and services, allowing for the reduction of costs associated with import and export processes. This resulted in expanded markets for businesses and consumers, leading to increased competitiveness and economic growth. However, it also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain sectors, particularly in manufacturing, as companies relocated production to countries with lower labor costs. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which built upon its predecessor's framework while addressing contemporary issues such as digital trade, labor rights, and environmental protections. Despite its controversial aspects, NAFTA played a crucial role in shaping economic relationships and trade policies in North America for over two decades. Correction: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, implemented on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate trade barriers and tariffs, fostering a trilateral trade bloc in North America. As one of the largest free trade zones in the world, it sought to increase economic integration and cross-border trade among the member countries. NAFTA significantly impacted the economies of the three nations. It facilitated the flow of goods and services, allowing for the reduction of costs associated with import and export processes. This resulted in expanded markets for businesses and consumers, leading to increased competitiveness and economic growth. However, it also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain sectors, particularly in manufacturing, as companies relocated production to countries with lower labor costs. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which built upon its predecessor's framework while addressing contemporary issues such as digital trade, labor rights, and environmental protections. Despite its controversial aspects, NAFTA played a crucial role in shaping economic relationships and trade policies in North America for over two decades.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Response: The debate around Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a crucial one, and in my opinion, companies absolutely have a responsibility to society that extends beyond merely maximizing profits for shareholders. While some argue a company's sole duty is to its investors, this perspective feels increasingly outdated. Businesses don't operate in a vacuum; they exist within communities, utilize shared resources, and rely on a healthy society for their workforce and consumer base. This interdependency creates an ethical obligation to contribute positively to the broader good. Beyond ethical considerations, CSR makes undeniable business sense. Consumers increasingly value and reward companies with strong social and environmental records, fostering loyalty and enhancing brand reputation. Furthermore, a genuine commitment to fair employee benefits and sustainable operations often leads to higher productivity, lower turnover, and a more engaged workforce. While some might view CSR spending as a mere marketing tactic, truly integrated efforts build long-term value and resilience, far surpassing any fleeting PR gains. Ultimately, while governments certainly set regulations, responsible companies go beyond minimum compliance, proactively addressing societal challenges. Integrating social and environmental responsibility into core operations isn't just about doing good; it's about building a more reputable, sustainable, and ultimately more profitable future for all stakeholders involved. Key qualities that define a good leader include effective communication, empathy, and decisiveness. Decisiveness is equally critical as it demonstrates confidence and the ability to take action even in uncertain situations. For instance, leading a group project at school or work provides opportunities to practice decision-making and teamwork. I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader in some capacity. With the right mindset and effort, anyone can develop the qualities needed to lead effectively. Proposed Cost-Cutting Measures
Review and Reduce Operational Costs

Energy Efficiency Initiatives: Implement energy-saving measures such as LED lighting, programmable thermostats, and energy-efficient appliances.

Office Supplies: Reduce the use of paper by promoting digital documentation and communication. Bulk purchasing of office supplies to take advantage of discounts.

Optimize Workforce Management

Remote Work: Encourage remote work to reduce office space and utility costs.

Flexible Working Hours: Introduce flexible working hours to reduce overtime costs.

Voluntary Time Off: Offer voluntary unpaid leave or sabbaticals to reduce payroll expenses temporarily.

Streamline Vendor and Supplier Contracts

Negotiations: Re-negotiate contracts with existing vendors and suppliers to obtain better rates or extended payment terms.

Vendor Consolidation: Consolidate purchases with fewer vendors to leverage bulk discounts.

Technology and Automation

Process Automation: Invest in automation tools to streamline repetitive tasks and reduce manual labor costs.

Software Subscriptions: Review and cancel unnecessary software subscriptions or switch to more cost-effective alternatives.

Optimize Marketing and Advertising Expenditure

Digital Marketing: Shift from traditional marketing channels to more cost-effective digital marketing strategies.

Content Creation: Utilize in-house resources for content creation instead of outsourcing.

Facilities Management

Lease Negotiations: Re-negotiate lease agreements or consider relocating to lower-cost facilities.

Shared Spaces: Explore shared office spaces or co-working spaces to reduce rental expenses.

Travel and Entertainment

Travel Policies: Implement stricter travel policies, including the use of video conferencing instead of in-person meetings.

Expense Limits: Set clear limits on entertainment and travel expenses.

Conclusion
By implementing these cost-cutting measures, we aim to achieve significant savings while maintaining operational efficiency and quality. We are committed to navigating this budget crisis with strategic planning and prudent financial management.

Travel and Entertainment

Expense Limits: Set clear limits on entertainment and travel expenses.

Conclusion
By implementing these cost-cutting measures, we aim to achieve significant savings while maintaining operational efficiency and quality. We are committed to navigating this budget crisis with strategic planning and prudent financial management.

Details of the Case:

Plaintiff's Position: Medina unlawfully entered the Byron family home, causing distress and terror.
Defendant's Position: Medina claimed he believed the house was empty and was seeking shelter at night. He admitted to ransacking the house in the process.
Verdict: The court found Medina guilty of trespassing, a criminal offense. The penalties imposed included a fine of $1,000, to be paid in two installments, with one payment to be made immediately. Additionally, Medina was sentenced to complete 300 hours of community service.

Commentary on the Verdict: The verdict appears appropriate given the circumstances of the case. Trespassing is a criminal offense, and the court's decision to impose a monetary fine and community service is a reasonable punishment for Medina's unlawful entry and the distress caused to the Byron family. The sentencing takes into account Medina's actions while providing a rehabilitative component through community service, which may deter similar behavior in the future. The fine and community service collectively serve as a punitive measure and a means of restitution for the disturbance caused by the trespass. Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language students often encounter a variety of issues and challenges that can delay their learning process. One significant challenge is the complexity of grammar rules and sentence structure which may vary a lot from the mother tongue. Additionally, students may struggle with pronunciation and intonation, making effective verbal communication difficult. Another common issue is the fear of making mistakes when talking in public, which can create anxiety in speaking and listening activities. This fear often leads to a lack of confidence and reluctance to participate in conversations impacting the learning experience. Cultural differences can play a role as well, affecting how students interpret language and communication styles. Lastly, finding opportunities for real-life practice outside the classroom can be challenging, leaving students feeling isolated and underprepared in their language acquisition journey. These obstacles require dedication and support to overcome and it can vary between students. Set your goals, practice regularly and don't be afraid of making mistakes. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesn’t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. He has got a few quotes for property and liability insurance, but they have been very high. He asks you to do a risk assessment of the premises. Have a look at your checklist, then write him an email advising him of the changes he has to make. Write 150-200 words. Response: Hi Garate,

I’ve completed the risk assessment for your secondhand clothes shop, and I can see why your insurance quotes have been high. There are several issues that need attention to reduce your risk and premiums.

Outside, there are loose bricks and blocked drainpipes that could cause accidents or water damage, so it’s important to repair these and clear them out. The leaky roof should also be fixed to prevent damage to your stock and the building. Keeping the yard and sidewalk clear of clutter will reduce the risk of slips and trips for customers.

Inside, poor lighting needs to be improved to prevent accidents and theft, and boxes should not be stacked unsafely as this can cause injuries. It’s essential to replace the old fire extinguishers with functioning ones and store loose chemicals properly to reduce fire hazards and health risks.

Making these changes will not only improve safety for your customers and staff but should also help lower your property and liability insurance costs.

Let me know if you need help prioritizing these tasks.

Best,
Juvenal Cárdenas Correction: <input>Hi Garate,

I’ve completed the risk assessment for your secondhand clothes shop, and I can see why your insurance quotes have been high. There are several issues that need attention to reduce your risk and premiums.

Outside, there are loose bricks and blocked drainpipes that could cause accidents or water damage, so it’s important to repair these and clear them out. The leaky roof should also be fixed to prevent damage to your stock and the building. Keeping the yard and sidewalk clear of clutter will reduce the risk of slips and trips for customers.

Inside, poor lighting needs to be improved to prevent accidents and theft, and boxes should not be stacked unsafely as this can cause injuries. It’s essential to replace the old fire extinguishers with functioning ones and store loose chemicals properly to reduce fire hazards and health risks.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Issues and Challenges Language Students Often Face Why is learning a new language difficult for many students? One major challenge is mastering pronunciation and listening skills. Different sounds, accents, and speech speeds can confuse learners, especially when they differ significantly from their native language. Another issue is vocabulary retention. How can students remember hundreds or thousands of new words? Without regular practice, new vocabulary is quickly forgotten. Grammar rules add another layer of complexity. Why are grammar rules so frustrating? Because they often include many exceptions and may not match the student’s native language structure. What about confidence? Many students fear making mistakes in front of others. This fear of embarrassment can stop them from speaking, even if they know the correct words. Motivation is another challenge. Why do some students give up? Progress may seem slow, especially without immediate rewards or real-life practice. Finally, lack of exposure is a common problem. Without daily interaction in the language, it’s hard to develop fluency. Watching shows, talking to native speakers, or traveling can help—but not everyone has those opportunities. In summary, language learners face difficulties with pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, confidence, motivation, and exposure. Overcoming these requires consistent practice, patience, and the right learning environment. Correction: Issues and Challenges Language Students Often Face Why is learning a new language difficult for many students? One major challenge is mastering pronunciation and listening skills. Different sounds, accents, and speech speeds can confuse learners, especially when they differ significantly from their native language. Another issue is vocabulary retention. How can students remember hundreds or thousands of new words? Without regular practice, new vocabulary is quickly forgotten. Grammar rules add another layer of complexity. Why are grammar rules so frustrating? Because they often include many exceptions and may not match the student’s native language structure. What about confidence? Many students fear making mistakes in front of others. This fear of embarrassment can stop them from speaking, even if they know the correct words. Motivation is another challenge. Why do some students give up? Progress may seem slow, especially without immediate rewards or real-life practice. Finally, lack of exposure is a common problem. Without daily interaction in the language, it’s hard to develop fluency. Watching shows, talking to native speakers, or traveling can help—but not everyone has those opportunities. In summary, language learners face difficulties with pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, confidence, motivation, and exposure. Overcoming these requires consistent practice, patience, and the right learning environment.

Key qualities such as communication skills, empathy, decisiveness, and integrity are often seen in effective leaders. Communication is crucial as it enables leaders to inspire and guide their teams clearly. Empathy allows leaders to understand and connect with their team members, fostering a supportive environment. Decisiveness is necessary for making timely decisions, while integrity builds trust and credibility.

In my observations, individuals who actively seek feedback and are open to growth often excel in leadership roles. For instance, a colleague who regularly sought mentorship and took on challenging projects gradually developed into a respected leader within the organization. They exhibited resilience and adaptability, learning from both successes and failures.

I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader in some capacity, as leadership is not confined to a specific role or title. It involves influencing and motivating others, which can occur in various contexts. However, realizing this potential requires commitment to personal development and a willingness to embrace challenges. By cultivating essential leadership qualities, anyone can grow into a leader and positively impact their community or organization. By resolving these issues, you should be able to secure more favorable insurance quotes. Wishing you the best of luck with your new venture! Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a major trade pact between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. After lengthy negotiations, it officially came into effect in January 1994. Its main goal was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and other trade barriers between the three countries, thereby encouraging the free flow of goods and services across borders. NAFTA has had a significant impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture and manufacturing. For example, it allowed Mexican fruits and vegetables to enter the U.S. market more easily, benefiting both producers and consumers. It also helped integrate supply chains across North America, making industries more competitive globally. However, the agreement has not been without controversy. While it created jobs and boosted exports in some regions, it also led to job losses and factory closures in others. Despite these challenges, NAFTA has generally been seen as beneficial for all three member countries, strengthening economic ties and promoting regional cooperation. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: Fuselage: The main body housing the cockpit, passenger cabin, cargo holds, and often fuel tanks. It connects wings and tail, forming the plane’s aerodynamic core. Wings & Control Surfaces: Wings generate lift and include key control parts: Ailerons (roll control) Flaps (added lift during takeoff/landing) Slats & Spoilers (lift modulation and descent control) Tail (Empennage): Stabilizers provide pitch (elevator) and yaw (rudder) control. Engines: Usually turbofan jets under wings for thrust; smaller planes may have propellers. They power flight and onboard systems. Landing Gear: Retractable wheels enabling takeoff, taxiing, and landing operations. Pilot-in-Command (Captain): Holds ultimate legal responsibility for safety, flight decisions, and authority on board . First Officer (Co‑pilot): Assists with flying, monitors systems, communicates with ATC, and shares cockpit workload. Flight Engineer (rare on modern airliners): Used to manage systems, fuel, hydraulics, ventilation, etc. . Crew Resource Management (CRM): Structured teamwork and communication between all crew members to promote safety and prevent errors . On long flights, pilots also act as: Meteorologists—tracking weather and adjusting routes Communicators—coordinating with ATC and dispatch Engineers—monitoring engines, fuel, and systems Diplomats—handling in-flight issues They rotate rest periods, especially on ultra long-haul flights . Correction: Fuselage: The main body housing the cockpit, passenger cabin, cargo holds, and often fuel tanks. It connects wings and tail, forming the plane’s aerodynamic core. Wings & Control Surfaces: Wings generate lift and include key control parts: Ailerons (roll control) Flaps (added lift during takeoff/landing Slats & Spoilers (lift modulation and descent control) Tail (Empennage): Stabilizers provide pitch (elevator) and yaw (rudder) control. Engines: Usually turbofan jets under wings for thrust; smaller planes may have propellers. They power flight and onboard systems. Landing Gear: Retractable wheels enabling takeoff, taxiing, and landing operations. Pilot-in-Command (Captain): Holds ultimate legal responsibility for safety, flight decisions, and authority on board . First Officer (Co‑pilot): Assists with flying, monitors systems, communicates with ATC, and shares cockpit workload. Flight Engineer (rare on modern airliners): Used to manage systems, fuel, hydraulics, ventilation, etc. . Crew Resource Management (CRM): Structured teamwork and communication between all crew members to promote safety and prevent errors . On long flights, pilots also act as: Meteorologists—tracking weather and adjusting routes Communicators—coordinating with ATC and dispatch Engineers—monitoring engines, fuel, and system Diplomats—handling in-flight issues They rotate rest periods, especially on ultra long-haul flights .

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane has many important parts that help it fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots sit. The fuselage is strong and shaped to reduce air resistance. The wings are attached to the fuselage and are very important for flying. They create lift, which helps the airplane rise into the air. Wings also have flaps and ailerons that help the pilot control the plane’s movement during takeoff, flight, and landing. The tail of the airplane includes the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. These parts keep the airplane stable and help control its direction. The vertical stabilizer helps the airplane turn left or right, while the horizontal stabilizer controls the up and down movement. Finally, the engines provide the power needed for the airplane to move forward. They push or pull the plane through the air and help it gain speed for takeoff and maintain speed during flight. All these parts work together to make flying possible and safe. Correction: An airplane has many important parts that help it fly safely and efficiently. The wings are attached to the fuselage and are very important for flying. They create lift, which helps the airplane rise into the air. Wings also have flaps and ailerons that help the pilot control the plane’s movement during takeoff, flight, and landing. The tail of the airplane includes the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. These parts keep the airplane stable and help control its direction. The vertical stabilizer helps the airplane turn left or right, while the horizontal stabilizer controls the up and down movement. Finally, the engines provide the power needed for the airplane to move forward. They push or pull the plane through the air and help it gain speed for takeoff and maintain speed during flight. All these parts work together to make flying possible and safe.

Response: Buying a home in India can be both an exciting and challenging experience. The process involves several steps, starting with determining your budget and preferred location. Housing prices vary significantly depending on the city and neighborhood. In metropolitan areas like Mumbai and Delhi, real estate can be quite expensive, whereas smaller cities may offer more affordable options.

Applying for a home loan in India requires thorough preparation. You need to gather documents such as proof of identity, address, income, and employment. The process involves filling out multiple forms and providing detailed financial information. Banks and financial institutions typically offer home loans with interest rates ranging from 7% to 9%, depending on the applicant's credit score and the loan amount.

While it's not mandatory to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker, their expertise can be invaluable. Real estate agents help you find suitable properties and negotiate deals, while mortgage brokers assist in finding the best loan options and navigating the application process. Their services can save time and reduce stress, especially for first-time homebuyers.

Overall, buying a home and securing a home loan in India involves careful planning and attention to detail. With the right preparation and support, it can be a rewarding journey towards owning your dream home. Correction: <input>Buying a home in India can be both an exciting and challenging experience. The process involves several steps, starting with determining your budget and preferred location. Housing prices vary significantly depending on the city and neighborhood. In metropolitan areas like Mumbai and Delhi, real estate can be quite expensive, whereas smaller cities may offer more affordable options.

Applying for a home loan in India requires thorough preparation. You need to gather documents such as proof of identity, address, income, and employment. The process involves filling out multiple forms and providing detailed financial information. Banks and financial institutions typically offer home loans with interest rates ranging from 7% to 9%, depending on the applicant's credit score and the loan amount.

While it's not mandatory to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker, their expertise can be invaluable. Real estate agents help you find suitable properties and negotiate deals, while mortgage brokers assist in finding the best loan options and navigating the application process. Their services can save time and reduce stress, especially for first-time homebuyers.

Overall, buying a home and securing a home loan in India involves careful planning and attention to detail. With the right preparation and support, it can be a rewarding journey towards owning your dream home.</input>

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: NAFTA, or the North American Free Trade Agreement, is a trilateral trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It officially came into force in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its main objective was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and trade barriers between the three countries, thereby encouraging economic cooperation and integration. The agreement has had a significant impact on trade relations, especially in sectors like agriculture. For instance, since NAFTA was implemented, the United States has seen a notable increase in the import of Mexican fruits and vegetables, which has benefited consumers and expanded market opportunities for Mexican farmers. Despite its many advantages, NAFTA has also had some negative consequences, such as job losses in certain manufacturing sectors due to companies relocating to countries with lower labor costs. However, the overall impact has been largely positive, fostering economic growth and increasing trade volume among the member nations. In summary, NAFTA has played a key role in shaping North American economic relations, proving beneficial to all three countries involved by promoting free trade and stronger regional ties. Correction: NAFTA, or the North American Free Trade Agreement, is a trilateral trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It officially came into force in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its main objective was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and trade barriers between the three countries, thereby encouraging economic cooperation and integration. The agreement has had a significant impact on trade relations, especially in sectors like agriculture. For instance, since NAFTA was implemented, the United States has seen a notable increase in the import of Mexican fruits and vegetables, which has benefited consumers and expanded market opportunities for Mexican farmers. Despite its many advantages, NAFTA has also had some negative consequences, such as job losses in certain manufacturing sectors due to companies relocating to countries with lower labor costs. However, the overall impact has been largely positive, fostering economic growth and increasing trade volume among the member nations. In summary, NAFTA has played a key role in shaping North American economic relations, proving beneficial to all three countries involved by promoting free trade and stronger regional ties.
